title: -Z build-std broken on latest nightly: could not read vendor path

labels.name: T-cargo
labels.description: Relevant to the cargo team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- The steps to reproduce the bug. -->
1. `cargo new --lib example && cd example`
2. `echo "#![no_std]" > src/lib.rs`
3. `cargo +nightly check --target x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -Z build-std=core`

(The actual target doesn't seem to matter, the `build-std` feature just requires that we pass a `--target` argument.)

The following error occurs:

> error: could not read vendor path /home/philipp/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/vendor
> 
> Caused by:
>   No such file or directory (os error 2)

### Cause

I think this issue occurs because https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80082 already landed, while the cargo-side revert in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80081 did not. So **this issue will likely go away after the next cargo update**. I still decided to open this issue in case other people encounter the same problem.
